message.content:
cs.CR, cs.GT, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SI 

This paper discusses the dynamics of mining pool selection in blockchain networks, which involves the security and game theory aspects of computer science. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also models the strategy evolution of individual miners as an evolutionary game, which falls under the category of cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory). Additionally, the paper considers the hash rate and block propagation delay, which are related to the network and distributed computing aspects of computer science, respectively. Therefore, cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) are also likely categories. Finally, the paper provides numerical simulations to support the theoretical analysis, which falls under the category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
